analysis.claim_text: On the eve of sailing aboard Duncan he met ex-General von Wallace and obtained notes on South-American inland geography and native customs.

sub_claims.text: On the eve of sailing aboard Duncan he met ex-General von Wallace and obtained notes on South-American inland geography and native customs.
Jacques Paganel was a character in the book 'In Search of the Castaways' by Jules Verne.
Jacques Paganel obtained notes on South-American inland geography and native customs from ex-General von Wallace.

analysis.reasoning: Contradiction (factual): The claim is that Paganel obtained notes on South-American inland geography and native customs from von Wallace before boarding the Duncan. However, the evidence shows that Paganel was not aware of the name or destination of the vessel on which he had taken passage until after Glenarvan explained it to him.
